Text: If my notebook does not support hardware virtualization can I still run this in VMware? TIA.
@press2010 Yes, there's a way around that included in the tutorial video, but you'd need v7.1.3 or 7.1.4 of VMware, and not the newest one (yet)

If you guys get an Error or it will only halt at the Apple logo, on the VMware options click edit Machine and then click the CPU tab. Then look underneath the numbers of CPU and click the box that says "Disable Acceleration for binary Translation" Hope that helps.
